title: SQ Lower Bounds for Non-Gaussian Component Analysis with Weaker Assumptions
abstract: arXiv:2403.04744v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: We study the complexity of Non-Gaussian Component Analysis (NGCA) in the Statistical Query (SQ) model. Prior work developed a general methodology to prove SQ lower bounds for this task that have been applicable to a wide range of contexts. In particular, it was known that for any univariate distribution $A$ satisfying certain conditions, distinguishing between a standard multivariate Gaussian and a distribution that behaves like $A$ in a random hidden direction and like a standard Gaussian in the orthogonal complement, is SQ-hard. The required conditions were that (1) $A$ matches many low-order moments with the standard univariate Gaussian, and (2) the chi-squared norm of $A$ with respect to the standard Gaussian is finite. While the moment-matching condition is necessary for hardness, the chi-squared condition was only required for technical reasons. translated_title: SQ在较弱假设下用于非高斯成分分析的下限
translated_abstract: 我们研究了统计查询（SQ）模型中非高斯成分分析（NGCA）的复杂性。 先前的工作开发了一种一般方法，用于证明这一任务的SQ下界，并适用于广泛的上下文。 特别地，已知对于满足某些条件的任何一维分布$A$，区分标准多元高斯和在随机隐藏方向上的行为类似$A$而在正交补上行为类似标准高斯的分布是SQ-hard的。 所需条件是（1）$A$与标准一维高斯匹配许多低阶矩，和（2）$A$相对于标准高斯的卡方范数是有限的。 虽然满足矩匹配条件对于难度是必要的，但卡方条件仅出于技术原因而被要求。 在这项工作中，我们证明了后一个条件实际上并非必要。
tldr: 本研究证明在非高斯成分分析中，对于区分标准多元高斯和在随机隐藏方向上行为类似某一维分布而在正交补上行为类似标准高斯的问题，先前被要求的卡方条件实际上是不必要的。
en_tdlr: This study proves that the chi-squared condition previously required in Non-Gaussian Component Analysis for distinguishing between a standard multivariate Gaussian and a distribution that behaves like a certain one-dimensional distribution in a random hidden direction and like a standard Gaussian in the orthogonal complement is actually unnecessary.
